p.s: In the following I am going to describe the situation Shylock finds himself in the given extract from the play The Merchant of Venice.
Shylock is one of the main characters from this play written by famous playwright William Shakespeare.
The play deals with the rich merchant Antonio, who'swhose friend Bassonio is in need of money.
AlthoughAllthoughAntonio is a wealthy man he is not abel to lend his friend the money, which leads to them having to borrow money from Shylock, a Jewish moneylender.
Shylock and Antonio however are enemies which is the reason for the risky deal Shylock suggests.
He agrees to lending the money to Bassanio but only if Antonio pays him back after three months.
If Antonio is unable to do so, Shylock is allowed to take one pound of Antonio's flesh.
In this extract Shylock is talking to a Jewish friend of his called Tubal.
Tubal has just come back from Genoa and delivers news he has to Shylock.
Tubal had been away looking for Shylock's daughter Jessica, who ran away from Venice with a Christian man.
Tubal however tells Shylock that he could not find Jessica allthoughalthough he hearedheard about her in a lot of places.
This makes Shylock angry leading to him complaining about all the unlucky things happening to him.
Not only the loss of his daughter but also the loss of treasures and money.
Tubal then goes on telling Shylock good news he heard quickly changing Shylock's mood from bad to good.
Tubal explains to Shylock that Antonio's ship has cast away coming from Tripolis and is gone.
But Tubal has got even more news changing Shylock's mood again.
Tubal found out that Jessica had been in Genoa and spent eighty ducats making Shylock very angry.
This anger however does not last very long when Tubal adds more news including Antonio , saying that divers of Antonio's creditors assured him that Antonio is finished.
Shylock's anger about his daughter combined with the good news about Antonio lead to him being even more angry with Antonio and looking forward to hurting him.

But Tubal has got even more news saying that Jessica has traded and old ring of Shylock's dead wife Leah for a monkey but quickly adds that Antonio is definitely ruined after hearing how angry Shylock gets about the ring.
The extract ends with Shylock looking forward to taking the flesh from Antonio and telling Tubal to hire an officer so that the deal could be fulfilled.
In conclusion you can say that Shylock finds himself in a situation of extreme mood changes because he gets a lot of good and a lot of bad news at the same time.
The good news seeing that Antonio is ruined and will have to pay a pound of his flesh, the bad ones that his daughter is still not found and the big loss of money and treasures.
In the end the good news however dominate levingleaving Shylock happy and excited aobut fulfilling the deal.
